intro: Haydenoxylon haberianum, commonly known as the Haberianum haydenoxylon, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Amborellaceae. It is characterized by its simple, undivided leaves and a unique reproductive structure that resembles a cone. The plant is primarily found in specific microhabitats in New Caledonia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features are of great interest to paleobotanists due to its evolutionary significance. The species exhibits a distinct morphology that provides insights into the early evolution of flowering plants.
